name: German Startups Group
overview: German Startups Group Berlin AG (GSG) is a seed venture capital investor in Berlin, Germany. GSG provides young enterprises the opportunity of receiving quick first financing. The group is headed by Christoph Gerlinger, a German serial entrepreneur, who took two of his companies public, and Alexander Kölpin and fills the gap between business angel and traditional VC investments. In accordance with its claim “smart, fast, and friendly money”, the group’s focus is on Berlin’s digital economy. In the initial phase the German Startups Group backs start-ups with a 50 to 250k Euros investment in minority shareholding, where it also welcomes the co-operation of other investors. Fundamental investment criteria include disruptive innovations for products or business models, high scalability and entrepreneurial talent. In addition to capital, GSG offers entrepreneurs the opportunity of receiving practical advice and active support covering any questions during all stages of the start-up phase. For their shareholders GSG are building a diversified portfolio of top internet startups made in Germany, focussing on European’s startup hotspot Berlin, the new creative eco system called “Silicon Allee”.

German Startups Group categorises itself as filling the gap between business angel and VC funding
German Startups Group is building a portfolio of investments in entrepreneurial companies
